titlestmt.titleproper: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia Treasurer records 1890-1919
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia Treasurer records

bioghist.p: George Vaux, Jr. (d. 1927) was a lawyer and geologist. He was elected a member of the Academy of Natural Sciences in 1892. In 1894 he was appointed as Treasurer of the Academy, a position he held until his death in 1927.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of George Vaux, Jr., Treasurer of the Academy. Materials include correspondence regarding estates and properties held by the Academy, including reports of income from rent and dividends, payments for insurance, interest, and repairs to properties; receipts; legal documents related to mortgages; statements of accounts; a ledger of general and special funds (1890-1899) and a general ledger (1895-1901); a copy of Edward D. Cope’s will; a statement of accounts of Cope’s estate; and a list of subscribers to the Cope Fund. The collection also includes a set of printed annual reports of the Treasurer of the Academy, 1890-1919.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia: ANSP accounting ledgers (collection 294) and records related to Richard Lamborn estate.
